Abstract

On July 2, 2024, the Society for Social Choice and Welfare will organize a workshop on “Participatory budgeting” at the Paris School of Economics.

Abstract

Les Journées de l’Economie invite you to the National Assembly on Thursday June 13, for the Matinale de l’Économie de l’Assemblée nationale on the theme: "How can we improve the performance of our education system?".

The panel will include Luc Behaghel, Professor at the Paris School of Economics, Gabrielle Fack, Professor of Economics at Paris-Dauphine University, Alexandre Portier, Member of Parliament for the Les Républicains group, and Cécile Rilhac, REN-affiliated Member of Parliament for the 3rd constituency of Val-d’Oise. The debate will be moderated by Jean-Marc Vittori, editorial writer at Les Echos.

Program:

9:30am-10:10am: Opening of the Matinale by the President of the French National Assembly and presentation of the AFSE prizes for the best economics books for students.

PSE-CEPR Policy Forum 2024

Abstract

The second edition of the PSE-CEPR Policy Forum will take place at the Paris School of Economics on June 5-7, 2024. The title of this year’s forum is: "Exploring the Science of the Brazil G20: Building A Just World and a Sustainable Planet".

Jointly organized with the Centre for Economic Policy Research (CEPR), the forum is organized around keynote lectures, high-level policy conversations, and sessions devoted to presenting and discussing recent academic papers. It also showcases the next generation of economists through poster sessions and presentations by advanced PhD students.

This edition will notably feature keynote lectures by Abhijit Banerjee (on Global Poverty), Esther Duflo (on Climate Change Compensation) and Gabriel Zucman (on International Taxation).

Abstract

It will take place on Monday January 29 at 6:30pm in the Daniel Cohen auditorium.

Esther Duflo, President of PSE, will introduce a round-table discussion with Coralie Chevallier, Director of Research (ENS - PSL), Ishac Diwan, Professor of Economics (ENS - PSL and PSE), Laurence Tubiana, Director of the European Climate Foundation and Alexandre Wickham, Daniel Cohen’s editor at the Éditions Albin Michel.

The round-table will be moderated by Alexandra Bensaïd, journalist at France Inter, and concluded by Michel Cohen.

Lecture by Andrei Shleifer: "Cognitive Economics"

Abstract

On October 13, Andrei Shleifer will give a lecture at the Paris School of Economics.

Venue: Paris School of Economics

48 boulevard Jourdan, 75014 Paris, room R2-01

Human choices are often unstable, dependent on normatively irrelevant features of the problem, and variable across people in similar situations. Standard economics resolves these challenges by constructing exotic preferences. Behavioral economics deals with them by proliferating biases. Neither unifies different phenomena effectively. An alternative strategy is to start with regularities of human cognition, such as perception, attention, and memory, and to derive how people represent problems, form beliefs, and make choices from those foundations. This approach unifies theoretically a broad range of puzzling findings, and incorporates new strategies of measurement and prediction. We illustrate the ideas of cognitive economics with examples of finance, macroeconomics, labor economics, political economy, and risk assessment using both experimental and field data.
